text: Trump is much older than Hitler was when he assumed power in Germany. Hitler became chancellor of Germany in 1933 at 44. Trump became president of the United States in 2016 at 70. There are of course other differences. In order to have a global empire Hitler had to go to war, which he ultimately lost. Trump was elected president of a country that already dominated, economically and militarily, and had by far the largest military and nuclear weapons.
